TEXT.English: After defeating (and eating) a living unit in battle, baby spider gains the [LINK=PROMOTION_GROWTH_SPURTS]Growth spurts[\LINK] promotion, transforming it into an [LINK=UNIT_SPIDER]adult spider[\LINK] with a probability of 20% per turn. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Baby Spiders are very weak individually, but the Archos civilization can make use of them by [LINK=SPELL_SMEAR_POISON]sacrificing[\LINK] them for poisoned weapons or [LINK=SPELL_CANNIBALIZE]feeding[\LINK] them to bigger spiders for healing. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Additionally, baby spiders grow stronger when large numbers of them are grouped together, gaining one stack of the [LINK=PROMOTION_SWARMING1]Swarming[\LINK] promotion for every 10 baby spiders in the same tile, up to 4 stacks. At [LINK=PROMOTION_SWARMING4]Swarming IV[\LINK] with 40 baby spiders, they gain the ability to target the weakest unit in a stack. [NEWLINE]Spiders can swap between two modes while in your borders. Hunting mode (starts enabled) grants stealth 1, hidden nationality, and prevents receiving defensive bonuses. Territorial mode removes stealth and hidden nationality, but allows defensive bonuses.

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Baby Spiders are very weak individually, but the Archos civilization can make use of them by [LINK=SPELL_SMEAR_POISON]sacrificing[\LINK] them for poisoned weapons or [LINK=SPELL_CANNIBALIZE]feeding[\LINK] them to bigger spiders for healing. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Additionally, baby spiders grow stronger when large numbers of them are grouped together, gaining one stack of the [LINK=PROMOTION_SWARMING1]Swarming[\LINK] promotion for every 10 baby spiders in the same tile, up to 4 stacks. At [LINK=PROMOTION_SWARMING4]Swarming IV[\LINK] with 40 baby spiders, they gain the ability to target the weakest unit in a stack. [NEWLINE]Spiders can swap between two modes while in your borders. Hunting mode (starts enabled) grants stealth 1, hidden nationality, and prevents receiving defensive bonuses. Territorial mode removes stealth and hidden nationality, but allows defensive bonuses.

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Baby Spiders are very weak individually, but the Archos civilization can make use of them by [LINK=SPELL_SMEAR_POISON]sacrificing[\LINK] them for poisoned weapons or [LINK=SPELL_CANNIBALIZE]feeding[\LINK] them to bigger spiders for healing. TEXT.English: From level 3, Spiders can choose 1 color among 5 possibilities:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Blue (Diver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_ARGYRONETA]Argyroneta[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Green (Spitter; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_VENENUM]Venenum[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Grey (Burrower; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_MUCRO]Mucro[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Red (Exploder; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_RHAGODESSA]Rhagodessa[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Yellow (Weaver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_TEXTUS]Textus[\LINK]). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Archosian Spiders can be [LINK=SPELL_SPIDER_ARCHOS]upgraded[\LINK] to [LINK=UNIT_GIANT_SPIDER]Giant Spiders[\LINK] once they reach level 4 and the Archosian capital has 8+ population. [NEWLINE]Spiders can swap between two modes while in your borders. Hunting mode (starts enabled) grants stealth 1, hidden nationality, and prevents receiving defensive bonuses. Territorial mode removes stealth and hidden nationality, but allows defensive bonuses.

Territorial mode removes stealth and hidden nationality, but allows defensive bonuses.

[NEWLINE]Spiders can swap between two modes while in your borders. Hunting mode (starts enabled) grants stealth 1, hidden nationality, and prevents receiving defensive bonuses. Territorial mode removes stealth and hidden nationality, but allows defensive bonuses.

TEXT.English: Giant Spiders can evolve along their color variant for even more powerful abilities:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Blue (Greater Diver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_ARGYRONETA_GREATER]Greater Argyroneta[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Green (Greater Spitter; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_VENENUM_GREATER]Greater Venenum[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Grey (Greater Burrower; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_MUCRO_GREATER]Greater Mucro[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Red (Greater Exploder; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_RHAGODESSA_GREATER]Greater Rhagodessa[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Yellow (Greater Weaver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_TEXTUS_GREATER]Greater Textus[\LINK]). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Archosian Giant Spiders can be sacrificed at the capital to create [LINK=BUILDING_ARCHOS_NEST_ADDON1]Broodchambers[\LINK] which powers up future spiders. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Giant Spiders of variant Green and Grey can be further [LINK=SPELL_GIANT_SPIDER_ARCHOS]upgraded[\LINK] to Behemoths once they reach level 8 and the Archosian capital has 16+ population. [NEWLINE]Spiders can swap between two modes while in your borders. Hunting mode (starts enabled) grants stealth 1, hidden nationality, and prevents receiving defensive bonuses. Territorial mode removes stealth and hidden nationality, but allows defensive bonuses.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can only be cast inside your borders. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Grants hidden nationality, stealth 1, and prevents receiving defensive bonuses.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can only be cast inside your borders. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Removes hidden nationality and stealth, and allows receiving defensive bonuses.
